publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-7485 Ted Brocklebank: Condolences to All Affected by the New Zealand Mine Tragedy—That the Parliament offers its sincere condolences to the families and friends of the 29 miners who have apparently perished following a second explosion at the Pike River mine near Greymouth, South Island, New Zealand; in particular extends profound sympathies to the nearest and dearest of the Scottish miners involved, Malcolm Campbell of St Andrews and Peter Rodger of Perth, and expresses sympathy to the New Zealand Government for its huge loss and gratitude for the support and practical assistance offered to the families and friends affected from outwith New Zealand. Supported by: Mike Pringle*, Helen Eadie*, Karen Gillon*, Kenneth Gibson*, Rob Gibson*, Bill Aitken*, Bob Doris*, Jamie McGrigor*, Hugh Henry*, Murdo Fraser*, Nanette Milne*, Liam McArthur*, Marilyn Livingstone*, Elizabeth Smith*, Mary Scanlon*, Dave Thompson*, Tricia Marwick*

S3M-7485 Condolences to All Affected by the New Zealand Mine Tragedy (lodged on 24 November 2010) Jamie Hepburn*, John Park*, Claire Baker*, John Wilson*, Jim Tolson*, Maureen Watt*, Margaret Mitchell*, Stuart McMillan*, Brian Adam*, Bill Kidd*, Hugh O’Donnell*, Robin Harper*, Cathy Peattie*, Jackie Baillie*, John Lamont*, Gil Paterson*, Aileen Campbell*, Ken Macintosh*, Patricia Ferguson*, John Farquhar Munro*

S3M-7485 Ted Brocklebank: Condolences to All Affected by the New Zealand Mine Tragedy—That the Parliament offers its sincere condolences to the families and friends of the 29 miners who have apparently perished following a second explosion at the Pike River mine near Greymouth, South Island, New Zealand; in particular extends profound sympathies to the nearest and dearest of the Scottish miners involved, Malcolm Campbell of St Andrews and Peter Rodger of Perth, and expresses sympathy to the New Zealand Government for its huge loss and gratitude for the support and practical assistance offered to the families and friends affected from outwith New Zealand. Supported by: Mike Pringle, Helen Eadie, Karen Gillon, Kenneth Gibson, Rob Gibson, Bill Aitken, Bob Doris, Jamie McGrigor, Hugh Henry, Murdo Fraser, Nanette Milne, Liam McArthur, Marilyn Livingstone, Elizabeth Smith, Mary Scanlon, Dave Thompson, Tricia Marwick, Jamie Hepburn, John Park, Claire Baker, John Wilson, Jim Tolson, Maureen Watt, Margaret Mitchell, Stuart McMillan, Brian Adam, Bill Kidd, Hugh O’Donnell, Robin Harper, Cathy Peattie, Jackie Baillie, John Lamont, Gil Paterson, Aileen Campbell, Ken Macintosh, Patricia Ferguson, John Farquhar Munro, Elaine Smith*
S3M-7485 Condolences to All Affected by the New Zealand Mine Tragedy (lodged on 24 November 2010) Shirley-Anne Somerville*
S3M-7485 Condolences to All Affected by the New Zealand Mine Tragedy (lodged on 24 November 2010) Sarah Boyack*
S3M-7485 Condolences to All Affected by the New Zealand Mine Tragedy (lodged on 24 November 2010) Joe FitzPatrick*
S3M-7485 Condolences to All Affected by the New Zealand Mine Tragedy (lodged on 24 November 2010) Linda Fabiani*
